The Crestron Toolbox provides the following system tools:

System Info: Displays general device information. Allows you to manage device functions and capture debugging information. This tool is a central access point to all the functionality a device supports—see Accessing Device Functions.

ss:Data.Font: : A simplified version of the System Info tool, providing access to the 5 or 6 most common and useful configuration settings and device functions.

Cell.Data: Network Device Tree: Lists devices detected on the network. Allows you identify devices, manage device Network IDs and link to the SMW Program Tree. This tool is a central access point to all the functionality a device supports—see Accessing Device Functions.

ss:Data.Font: : Displays the file system. Allows you to manage control system files and directories.
: Samples voltages on the Cresnet Y and Z wires. Allows you to troubleshoot Cresnet network problems.
: Uploads system updates to multi-component devices such as the AES and MPS-100 in one step.
: Runs scripts for automating system tasks.
: Debugs SIMPL Windows programs in real time.
: Lists devices in a SIMPL Windows program. Allows you to update firmware, verify devices, upload projects and link to the Network Device Tree.
: Monitors performance and network data from Crestron control processors in real time.
: Performs text-based (command-line) functions.
: Generates test patterns for calibrating video.

Cell.Data: The Crestron Toolbox also provides the following configuration/diagnostic tools:

ss:Data.Font: : Configures menus and user prompts for the CEN-TIA telephone interface.
: Commissions DALI devices.
: Configures Crestron devices such as the CEN-WAP that support discovery protocols.
: Learns third-party manufacturer's IR codes.
: Configures audio/video source settings and switching in Crestron DMPS-Series systems.
: Configures audio/video source settings and switching in a Crestron DigitalMedia™ system in real time.
(if installed): Configures the video window layouts, display output and input sources of the DVPHD.
Creates, loads or modifies a custom EDID (Extended Display Identification Data).
Configures and adjusts audio speakers, input and outputs settings, decoding modes, equalization, and mixer outputs via the HD-XSP Surround Sound Processor.
: Configures and analyzes devices on an infiNET EX network.
: Configures the audio/video settings of switchers and processors in real time.
: Configures and reports the power settings and operational status of the CEN-UPS1250.
(if installed): Configures the audio EQ settings of an AMS-based system.
(if installed): Configures the room and source settings for a PAMP4x100 amplifier.
: Configures the real-time source selection, bridging, bussing, audio and EQ settings of a Sonnex system.

Cell.Data:
1. Run "crestron toolbox secure mode" exe which is available on \\crestdata2\codestore\SWTools\Alpha\CrestronToolbox\For_Software_Test\Toolbox 3.03.333 - 9-5-2019\Toolbox Secure Edition\crestron_toolbox_secure_mode_conversion.exe
Note: - each TB build have "crestron toolbox secure mode" in the same package
1. should pops up dialog to install crestron toolbox secure mode conversation 2. following user friendly instruction, should able to successfully install secure mode toolbox conversion
1. run test case mentioned in "TC_SecureModeTB_01" 2. Open Toolbox >> click Help >> select About Crestron Toolbox..
1. should display "Crestron Secure Toolbox" with the current TB version
Upgrade Toolbox and verify Secure Mode Toolbox
1. Complete Test case TC_SecureModeTB_01 2. Install higher vesion of Toolbox than currently installed version on your testing PC 3. Run Test case TC_SecureModeTB_02
2. should result the same as mentioned in TC_SecureModeTB_02 expected result
Exit out from secure mode toolbox
1. Un-install TB 2. Re - install any TB version
1. Verify the toolbox should be in normal mode 2. Verify addressbook icon in Toolbox
Verify secure Mode Toolbox with Address Book
1. run test case mentioned in "TC_SecureModeTB_01" 2. Open Toolbox 3. Open Toolbox >> click Tools
1. On Toolbox main view there should not have address book image icon 2. Tools menu should display the address book options
verify secure Mode Toolbox with Device Discovery Tool

1. run test case mentioned in "TC_SecureModeTB_01" 2. Open Toolbox >> click Tools >> select Device Discovery Tool option >> right click from discovered device 3. Repeat step 2 by opening Device discovery tool from image icon available in Toolbox main view 4. Open Toolbox >> click Tools >> selct DDT >> click remote search radio button after discovering devices 5. Verify functionality of DDT such as: a. discover the connected devices both USB and TCP connection types b. Quck Filter the discovered devices with available options (Modelname, or hostname) c. double click device from discovered list d. discover device using remote search

1. There should not have any option. 2. User should not able to copy the selected device's information 3. In remote search, there will display additional controls at the bottom of the tool. And there shouldn't have drop down option to select any saved entry of addressbook. 4. verify, there shouldn't have addressbook image at the bottom of the tool's dialog 5. There shouldn't have addressbook option on Edit Address dialog (pop up dialog when clicked pencil icon to connect to device). 6. verify edit address dialog doesn't save previously connected IP/hostname 6. Functionality of DDT should remain same as in normal mode of TB
verify secure Mode Toolbox with DMPS Tool

1. run test case mentioned in "TC_SecureModeTB_01" 2. Open Toolbox >> click Tools >> select DMPS Tool 3. Connect compatible device with DMPS tool: Open Toolbox >> click Tools >> select DMPS tool >> click pencil icon >> enter valid hostname/IP address 4. Repeat step 3 to connect with USB connection type

1. In DMPS Tool main view, there shouldn't have address book options 2. verify, DMPS tool shouldn't have addressbook image icon at the bottom of the tool's dialog 3. There shouldn't have addressbook option on Edit Address dialog (pop up dialog when clicked pencil icon to connect to device). 4. verify edit address dialog doesn't save previously connected IP/hostname 5. Functionality of DMPS Tool should remain same as in normal mode of TB
verify secure Mode Toolbox with Security Audit Tool

1. run test case mentioned in "TC_SecureModeTB_01" 2. Open Toolbox >> click Tools >> select Security Audit Tool >> click Add Devices button 3. Add devices from different method (discovery, import, single device options) >>run analysise

1. There shouldn't have address book options on Add Devices dialog 2. Functionality of Security Audit Tool should remain unchange as in normal mode of TB 3. There shouldn't have addressbook option on Edit Address dialog (pop up dialog when clicked pencil icon to connect to device while adding single device). 4. verify edit address dialog doesn't save previously connected IP/hostname
verify secure Mode Toolbox with HD-XPA Tool

1. run test case mentioned in "TC_SecureModeTB_01" 2. Open Toolbox >> click Tools >> select HD-XSP Tool 3. Connect compatible device with HD-XSP tool: Open Toolbox >> click Tools >> select HD-XSP tool >> click pencil icon >> enter valid hostname/IP address 4. Repeat step 3 to connect with USB connection type
1. In HD-XSP Tool main view, there shouldn't have address book options 2. Functionality of HD-XSP Tool should remain same as in normal mode of TB
verify secure Mode Toolbox with File Manager Tool

1. run test case mentioned in "TC_SecureModeTB_01" 2. Open Toolbox >> click Tools >> select FIle Manager Tool 3. Connect compatible device with File manager tool: Open Toolbox >> click Tools >> select File Manager tool >> click pencil icon >> enter valid hostname/IP address 4. Transfer file to device: a. drag the file into selected folder on the connected device b. right click from the device's folder location and select transfer file >> open file browser >> select the deisre file 5. Transfer file from device: a. right click on the file or folder from the device which desire to transfer >> open file browser >> save in desire path

1. verify, File manager tool shouldn't have addressbook image icon at the bottom of the tool's dialog 2. There shouldn't have addressbook option on Edit Address dialog (pop up dialog when clicked pencil icon to connect to device). 3. verify edit address dialog doesn't save previously connected IP/hostname 4. Functionality of File Manger Tool should remain same as in normal mode of TB
1. run test case mentioned in "TC_SecureModeTB_01" 2. click File menu >> select Preference options

verify following information on preference dialog: 1. Under New Tool windows section, options of "automatically connect to" should have Address book Default options as grayed out or disable 2. check box options under Addressbook section should be grayed out or disable 3. Options under Encryption section should be disable or grayed out 4. Options under Credentiasl section should be disable or grayed out
verify secure mode toolbox from different UAC (Admin) priviledge
1. Open PC with Admin Access level Account >> Repeat test cases from "TC_SecureModeTB_02" to "TC_SecureModeTB_08"
1. Should behave same as in normal Toolbox for Admin user 2. should result same as mentioned above to its respective test cases
verify secure mode toolbox from different UAC (non- Admin) priviledge
1. Open PC with non -Admin Access Level Account >> Repeat test cases from "TC_SecureModeTB_02" to "TC_SecureModeTB_08"
1. Should behave same as in normal Toolbox for non -Admin user 2. should result same as mentioned above to its respective test cases
Verify secure mode toolbox with connection stress

1. run test case mentioned in "TC_SecureModeTB_01" 2. Open Toolbox >> click Tools >> select differnt tools (such as easy config, system info, text console ..) 3. Connect compatible device with opened tools vias different connection types: a. TCP connctions (ssh, auto, ctp, ssl) b. USB connections (modelname, serial and hostname) c. Serial connection d. Indirect conection (cresnet, infinet, slot)

1. Any opened Tool's shouldn't have address book options image icon at the bottom of the tool's dialog 2. There shouldn't have addressbook option on Edit Address dialog (pop up dialog when clicked pencil icon to connect to device). 3. verify edit address dialog doesn't save previously connected IP/hostname 4. Should connect to the device correctly and functional as in normal mode toolbox

ss:Data.Font: • Uninstall Toolbox-Reinstall the new build. • Install the new build on a clean machine. • Install the last released build - Upgrade to the new build. • Enabled UAC and preformed the above steps. • Perform the installation using different OS Windows environment XP, W7 and W8. • Install the standalone Tools

Cell.Data: Before executing the installation of toolbox, right click go to properties and look for Digital Signitures tab and check the Crestron Signature is present

• Try several monitor resolutions for the application in general. Exit Toolbox before changing monitor resolution. • Try different Windows font size.
For Windows 7 /10 font size: Control Panel\Appearance and Personalization\Personalization\Display @1920x1080 o Smaller- 100% o Medium- 125% o Large- 150%
@4k resolution o Smaller- 150% o Medium- 200% o Large- 300%
Choose each font and verify display is scaled properly. Check with Tools and dialogs.
1. only verified with available window10 2. Doesn't have horizonal or vertical scroll bar to view the opened tools when DPI resolution changed to 150%
1. Should have side arrow UI control to view all shortcut image icon when toolbox preference setup as "Large" icon size

• Multiple views of same device 1. Use text console, several System Info tools (try with each of the other tools also). Point to same control system. Check that the data is the same. Attempt to refresh several tools at the same time. 2. Check that changing the address in some way (baud rate of serial connection, IP address of Ethernet connection) notifies and reconnects all and changes the address book to reflect the new address, if the Preference is set to do so.
• Multiple views of different devices 1. Use SysInfo to look at the control system, then look at a device (uses pass-to). Use another SysInfo to try to look at the control system or another device.

• Open many Tools, DMPS, DM, DVPHD close one while another one is loading. • Using discovery Tool to select different device while another device info is loading. • Open multi instances of Toolbox and open a Tool that takes long time to load. • Use different connection types to run some Tools at the same time, USB, Serial, TCP or indirect to a Cresnet device. • Run a Puf tool and load to any device then open toolbox and open any Tool that requires to read from a device, Sonnex, SystemInfo, Procise, etc. • Close a Tool abruptly while other Tool is launching. _____________________________________________
The following tests should cover the crashes fix: 1. Test unexpected loss of connection a. Open Text Console and DMPS Tool and connect both to the same DMPS. b. Wait for both tools to finish initializing. c. Type the “reboot” command in the Text Console and press the enter key to execute it. d. The DMPS tool should change state to show it is now disconnected. 2. Test reconnection a. Open DMPS Tool and connect to a DMPS. b. Wait for it to finish initializing. c. Reconnect by selecting the same address in the address combo box.
The following tools use the code (EnginePlugin) that had the most change: - DALI Tool - DMPS Tool - EasyConfig - EDID Tool - GLS Energy Meter Tool - HD-XSP Tool - Prodigy Tools - PROCISE Tools - RGBHVHB Tool - Sonnex Tool
Exist one issue -TOOLBX-1686, which marked as WONTFIX and closed
Toolbox- UAC Admin Account (User Account Control)

UAC- User Account Control- Applies to admin and standard user accounts. It should be tested with OS W7 and W8. Toolbox supports UAC enabled on both accounts privilege. A user should not notice any difference when running Toolbox on a UAC enabled machine. The difference is only in the locations where Toolbox saves files.
Test the following items: 1. Device Discovery/ Easy Configure 2. SystemInfo ( connecting to a controller, Switcher, Touch screen..etc.) 3. Device Learner . 4. Loading a simpl windows project from TB. 5. Loading a VTPro-e project from TB. 6. Standalone programs: a.DVPHD b.Procise
Toolbox- UAC Standard- User Account (User Account Control)

Enable UAC on a PC and connect to an account with Standard User Privilege.
UAC- User Account Control- Applies to admin and standard user accounts. It should be tested with OS W7 and W8. Toolbox supports UAC enabled on both accounts privilege. A user should not notice any difference when running Toolbox on a UAC enabled machine. The difference is only in the locations where Toolbox saves files.
Test the following items: 1. Device Discovery/ Easy Configure 2. SystemInfo ( connecting to a controller, Switcher, Touch screen..etc.) 3. Device Learner . 4. Loading a simpl windows project from TB. 5. Loading a VTPro-e project from TB. 6. Standalone programs: a.Procise b.DaliTool c.DSP Tool d.BPC8 Tool
Use 3-series control system with v1.008.0002. or later. For more info on this topic please see the document on Crestron WiKi:
http://linux1/wiki/index.php/Toolbox_Changes_for_User_Account_Control_(UAC)

No OS W7 or W8 to test with.

ss:Data.Font: Credentials: =========== Select the checkbox options and should expected as:
: prompts the user for the device login credentials every time the device is opened within the current Toolbox Session and from session to session.

B.Font: Save Credentials for the duration of the Toolbox Session:

ss:Data.Font: prompts the user for the device login credentials when the device is initially opened and saves these device credentials for the duration of the current Toolbox Session, but not from session to session.

B.Font: Save Credentials on the PC later use

ss:Data.Font: : prompts the user for the device login credentials when the device is initially opened and saves these device credentials for the duration of the current Toolbox Session and from Toolbox session to session.
Clearing Credentials: ================== select following clear buttons and should expect as:
: click this Clear button to clear default device credentials.

B.Font: Clear All Saved Credentials from the PC

ss:Data.Font: : click this Clear button to clear all saved device credentials from the PC; this clears all device credentials from the current Toolbox session and subsequent session(s). Therefore, the user will be prompted for device login credentials when this device is opened again

Cell.Data: verify dialogue doesn't pop up to select default credential on first time boot

1. open toolbox >> file >> preferences >> clear default credential 2. Open text console and connect with device >> send "restore" command >> wait for 4-5 mins 3. reconnect to the same device >> verify there should not display additonal pop up dialogue as shown below in figure 1.
Note; - device is used for the first time coming out from production, then follow step 1 frist >> verify there should not display additonal pop up dialogue as shown below in figure 1.
verify dialogue pop up to select default credential on first time boot

1. Start toolbox with the state where it has a default credential set. Refer above test case in order to Enable "set default credential" 2. Open text console tool and connect with device >> send "restore" command >> wait for 4-5 mins 3. reconnect to the same device >> verify UI pop up as shown below in figure 1. in which have a user options while creating an account
Note; - device is used for the first time coming out from production, then follow step 1 frist >> should display the same result of pop up dialogue as shown in figure 1 below
verify creating account on first time boot with default credential without selecting checkbox option "Apply to all in current TB session"

1. This is a continuation from above test case "TC_Sanity_18" 2. From the UI dialogue as shown in figure 1 >> un-select check box option "Apply to all in current TB session" and click Yes option >>should not prompt user to enter username and password to create an account 3. verify connecting to the device with default credenitial >> user should be able to connect to the device with saved credential
verify creating account on first time boot with user credential without selecting checkbox option "Apply to all in current TB session"

1. This is a continuation from above test case "TC_Sanity_18" 2. From the UI dialogue as shown in figure 1 >> un-select check box option "Apply to all in current TB session" and click No option >>should display another dialogue to create an account >> should be able to create an account with valid username, password and verify password 3. verify connecting to the device with created credenitial >> user should be able to connect to the device
verify check box "Apply to all in current TB session" on first time boot with default credential

1. Start toolbox with the state where it has a default credential set. Refer above test case in order to Enable "set default credential" 2. Open two text console tools and connect with two devices in each tools >> send "restore" command on both devices one at a time >>wait for 4-5 mins 3. Attempt to re-connect with one device >> should display UI dialogue as shown in figure 1 >> select check box option "Apply to all in current TB session" and click Yes option >>should not prompt user to enter username and password to create an account 4. verify connecting to the device with default credenitial >> user should be able to connect to the device with saved credential 5. Attempt to re-connect with another device >> should not display UI dialogue as shown in figure 1 >> should automatically create an account with default credential 6. verify connecting to second device with default credential >> should be able to connect with default credential
verify check box "Apply to all in current TB session" on first time boot with user credential

1. Start toolbox with the state where it has a default credential set. Refer above test case in order to Enable "set default credential" 2. Open two text console tools and connect with two devices in each tools >> send "restore" command on both devices one at a time >>wait for 4-5 mins 3. Attempt to re-connect with one device >> should display UI dialogue as shown in figure 1 >> select check box option "Apply to all in current TB session" and click No option >>should prompt user to enter username and password to create an account >> entering valid username, password and verify password should be able to create an account 4. verify connecting to the device with created credenitial >> user should be able to connect to the device with saved credential 5. Attempt to re-connect with another device >> should not display UI dialogue as shown in figure 1 >>should prompt user to enter username and password to create an account >> entering valid username, password and verify password should be able to create an account 6. verify connecting to second device with user created credential >> should be able to connect with default credential

1. Launch Toolbox. 2. Click Tools > Crestron MediaTools.
1. Tool is opened 2. Shows blank window with text "Device Not Found or Not Supported".
1. Launch Toolbox. 2. Click Tools > Crestron MediaTools. 3. Connect via Ethernet. 4. Connect via RS232. 5. Connect via Cresnet. 6. Connect via USB.

1. Supported Ethernet: MP2E, CEN-RGBHV series, C2VEQ-4 Y-bus card slot in a 2-Series control system 2. Supported Cresnet: CEN-RGBHV series, C2N-VEQ4 3. Supported RS232: MP2, MP2E 4.Supported USB: CEN-RGBHV series 5. Tool connects and populates with expected audio and video matrix for the device (See Fig.1 for MP2E expected).
Connect to device and review Audio matrix: 1. Number of inputs 2. Input gain (per input) 3. EQ & Presets 4. Volume & Tone Controls 5. Audio output level

Audio matrix area displays as expected: 1. Shows all inputs and outputs (likely to vary among supported devices) 2. Shows current decibel level of each input gain (inline with each input) 3. Shows currently selected input (indicated by blue line) 4. Shows current EQ band mode 5. Shows current decibel level of audio output(s).
1. Connect to device; set up device with audio source(s) and conect audio output so that it can be monitored. 2. Click each input's radio button to select it.

1. Selected input is routed to audio output in real time. 2. UI is updated to show which input is curently selected (as indicated by blue line extending from input through the audio matrix to the audio output).
Verification Of Audio Matrix Buttons' Child Dialog
1. Connect to device with Crestron MediaTools 2. Press each button available in Audio Matrix (e.g., Input Gains, EQ Band Mode, etc.).
1. Each button opens the correct child window. 2. Each child window contains the correct controls \ options for that feature. 3. Range of values is corect (e.g. decibel range, etc.)
1. [Crestron MediaTools] Error when closing dialogs via “X” button
1. Connect to device with Crestron MediaTools 2. Press each button (e.g., Input Gains, EQ Band Mode, etc.). 3. Reposition dialog so that the main tool window can be seen.
1. Main tool window can be acted upon while child windows are also open.

1. Connect to device; set up device with audio source(s) and connect audio output so that it can be monitored. 2. Press a given button (e.g., Input Gains, EQ Band Mode, etc.). 3. Reposition dialog so that the main tool window can be seen. 4. Use sliders (mouse \ keyboard control) as well as direct input fields to make adjustments in the opened child window.

1. Controls in child dialog respond as expected and affect change in real time (i.e., you can hear the expected change). 2. Any values which should update to the main tool window in real time (e.g., Input Gain dB, EQ Band Mode, etc.). 3. Results are the same regardless of method used to make adjustments
Connect to device and review Video matrix: 1. Number of inputs 2. Input gain (per input) 3. EQ & Presets 4. Video Source Analyzer (if applicable) 5. Audio Follows Video checkbox (if applicable)

Video matrix shows: 1. Number of inputs, per input type (determined by radio button selection) 2. Shows visual indication of which input is routed to each output 3. Combo boxes for assignment of video input(s) to video output(s) 4. Video outputs are clearly labeled
1. Connect to device; set up device with video source(s) and conect video output so that it can be monitored. 2. Select each input's combo box options.
1. Selected video source is routed to video output in real time. 2. Combo box contains all expected video inputs of the current device (dependent on device configuration)
1. Connect to device; set up device with audio source(s) and connect audio output so that it can be monitored. 2. Press MUTE button to toggle mute state.

1. Device mute toggles to expected state. 2. "Crossed circle" icon is shown to the right of MUTE button. 3. "Crossed circle" icon shown near Audio Out. 4. Blue line representing Audio Out becomes greyed. 5. "Crossed circle" icon shown on "Volume / Tone Controls" child window.
1. Launch Toolbox. 2. Click Tools > Crestron MediaTools. 3. Connect to a device other than the ones which are supported for the tool.
1. Tool should not connect; displays "Device Not Found or Not Supported". 2. Toolbox should handle gracefully / not crash.

1. Launch Toolbox. 2. Click Tools > Crestron MediaTools. 3. Connect to supported device. 4. Take device offline while connection is active (i.e., pull Ethernet cable, power off, etc.). 5. Attempt to interact with device using tool.

ss:Data.Font: 1. Toolbox will show "DEVICE DISCONNECTED" user facing message (see below

Cell.Data: Out of range values in input fields (child dialogs)

1. Connect to device; set up device with audio source(s) and connect audio output so that it can be monitored. 2. Press a given button (e.g., Input Gains, EQ Band Mode, etc.). 3. Enter values outside the expected range in the various input fields.

1.Tool should reject values outside of allowed range and use largest allowed value (E.g., if "55" is entered for an Input Gain and the existing value is 5, tool will automatically apply maximum value of 10)
Unsupported characters in input fields (child dialogs)

1. Connect to device; set up device with audio source(s) and connect audio output so that it can be monitored. 2. Press a given button (e.g., Input Gains, EQ Band Mode, etc.). 3. Enter unsupported characters in the various input fields.
1. Tool should reject any unsupported characters (Behavior may vary depending on which field is being used)

1. Open Toolbox and CEN-TIA Menu Builder Tool 2. Connect to Device 3. Create New Project 4. Right-Click Key >> Delete Event 5. Click Menu >> Click New 6. Choose Type and Add Details 7. Save 8. Click Menu and Select Event 9. Click Edit and Change Value in Event 10. Click Save 11. Load Project
1. Verify can conect to device 2. Verify project was created 3. Verify Event is deleted 3. Verify New Event is Added 4. Verify Event was reflects new changes 5. Verify project loads to device

1. Open Toolbox and CEN-TIA Menu Builder Tool 2. Connect to Device 3. Create New Project 4. Click Key >> New 5. Choose Command Type and add setting 6. Click Save 7. Click Command >> Edit 8. Change command type >>Click Save 9. Click Command >> Remove Selected

1. Open Text Console and connect to device 2. Click Logging >> Start Logging... 3. Enter command in buffer 4. Click Logging >> Pause Logging 5. Enter command in buffer 6. Click Logging >> Resume Logging 7. Enter command in buffer 8. Click Logging >> Stop Logging

1. When logging has started, buffer should be saved in the log files 2. When logging has been paused, none of the buffer should be saved in the log files 3. When logging has been resumed, buffer should be saved again in the log files 4. When logging has been stopped, buffer should stop being saved in the log files

1. Open Text Console and connect to device 2. Click Logging >> Load Toolbox Log 3. Select valid .tblog file to open 4. Click Logging >> Go Back Online 5. Reconnect to device
Note: - verify loading the large log (50 MB or larger)

1. Should display the buffer of log file in text console window by stopping the current session 2. Should not display the connection of device (if previously connected with any device) 3. When "Go Back Online" is used, can start connection to device again
1. Open Text Console and connect to RS232 device 2. Click Communications >> Disconnect 3. Hit Enter key in buffer
1. Device connected should should show "Disconnected" in the bottom 2. Hitting enter key should cause tool to attempt to connect to the device again
Doesn't have a setup to verify RS-232
1. Open Text Console and connect to RS232 device 2. Click Communications >> Xmodem Send... 3. Select file to send to device

1. When option is used, open file dialog should appear for file section 2. After file is chosen, file transfer dialog should appear 3. Ensure after file transfer completes that file is listed on the device
Doesn't have a setup to verify RS-232
1. Open Text Console and connect to device 2. Click Communications >> Xmodem Recieve 3. Chose location to save file to

1. When option is used, save file dialog should appear for save location 2. After location is chosen, file transfer dialog should appear 3. Ensure after file transfer complete that file is saved onto computer
need information to use this options. No information in Help file
1. Open Text Console and connect to device 2. Enter command in buffer 3. Highlight text in buffer >> Right click >> Copy 4. Right click >> Paste
1. Verify that text values can be copied and pasted in the text console through the right click options

1. Open Text Console and connect to device 2. Click Text Console >> Buffer Management… 3. Adjust "Max Buffer Size" and "Trim Size" slider 4. Toggle checkbox for displaying percentage in title bar 5. Click "Ok" to apply Buffer Management changes 6. Test out new buffer size

1. Verify that the "Buffer Management" dialog appears and reflects "Current Buffer Usage" in the Text Console 2. Once sizes are adjusted, just "Current Buffer Usage" percentage calculation in title bar to verify that settings were applied 3. Attempt to acceed buffer size to see trim buffer being applied 4. Toggle checkbox and then verify that percentage is either being shown or hidden

1. Open Text Console and connect to device 2. Click Text Console >> Edit Sequence Keys 3. Create new .keyset file and browse to it's location 4. Select key listed and edit it's information 5. Test out custom key in text console 6. Click Text Console >> "Select Key Set" to chose original keyset 7. Test same shortcut key

1. Ensure that the Sequence Key Setup dialog appears 2. Ensure that a custom keyset can be defined and that both an ability and an ability group can be used for the shortcut 3. Use the custom shortcut and verify that it does the correct behavior 4. Ensure that you can switch between key sets and get the correct shortcut behavior based on the key set selected

1. Open Text Console and connect to device 2. Click Text Console >> Edit Styles... 3. Acknowledge warning 3. Create new .tss file and browse to it's location 4. Name the style and chose a background color 5. Click "Add" and set a rule 6. Make a few rules and reorder 7. Test custom style on text console 8. Click Text Console >> "Select Style" to toggle between styles

1. Verify that the Style Editor appears and can create custom style 2. Ensure that style name is applied when seen in "Select Style" list 3. Verify that the background color is applied to the console 4. Verify that rules are applied to the text when console is used 5. Switch between styles and ensure they get applied

1. Open Text Console and connect to device 2. Enter command in buffer (Ex. "VER") 3. Click Text Console >> Command History (Or use Up Arrow in editor) 4. Use arrow keys to navigate through the history 5. Use tab key to modify command entered (Ex. "VER -V") and hit enter to use
1. Ensure that command history appears with either methods and contains valid history of current session 2. Verify that existing command in the history can be modified and then used

1. Open Text Console and connect to device 2. Enter command in buffer 3. Use Text Console >> "Text Info Window" to toggle the various options 4. In the buffer, hold shift key and hover over commands 5. Use Text Console >> Toggle Hex Mode

1. Verify that can toggle the various options to show or hide data within the Text Info Window 2. Validate that when shift is held that "Text Info Window" tooltip appears and reflects valid information about the command in focus 3. Verify that HEX values will be translated to ASCII in the "Text Info Window" when in hex data is in the buffer

1. Open Text Console and connect to device 2. Press enter key in buffer 3. Use Text Console >> "Outgoing <CR> to <CR> <LF>" to enable 4. Press enter key in buffer 5. Use Text Console >> "Outgoing <CR> to <CR> <LF>" to disable
1. When option is enabled, enter key should be carriage return/line feed when use and should not cause any errors on the device 2. When option is disabled, enter key should br carriage return only

1. Open Text Console and connect to device 2. Use Text Console >> Transmit Arrow Character 3. Acknowledge warning message 5. Use arrow keys in the buffer 6. Use Text Console >> Transmit Arrow Character 7. Use arrow keys in the buffer

1. When "Transmit Arrow Character" is enabled, buffer should accept hex values for the various arrow keys when pressed that then can be sent to device in a command 2. When "Transmit Arrow Character" is disabled, buffer will use arrow keys not for their character values but as various shortcut keys/arrow key functionalities within an editor (Ex. Up arrow brings up "Command History" window)
1. Open Text Console and connect to device 2. Change various settings under Text Console menu item 2. Use Text Console >> Make THIS my default 3. Close/Reopen Text Console
1. Option should save the current settings as the default for all new instances of the Text Console
1. Click Tools >> Text Console 2. Press F1
1. Should open Text Console help file and mapped to the right help page
1. Click Tools >> Text Console 2. Attempt connection with invalid type (Ex. Try to connect 3- series control sytem with RS232 connection type)
1. Connection should fail to connect in text console 2. TB shouldn't crashed
1. Indirect Connections Have Malformed Connection Strings When Entry Is Created In Address Book
Verify user can connect to DALI-Commissioning tool – perform discovery for Short and long address DALI devices.
1. Connect device with 6 -bit and 24-bit address in each DALI loop. 2.Perform device discovery by selecting loop and corresponding radio button >> Click discover >> confirm yer
Progress bar will be displayed and all ballast settings are retrieved and all ballast devices are displayed in address table.
Verify Loop1 and Loop2 and make sure connected ballast are shown. Verify- Duplicate, unused, missing, new, not found, failure and properly commissioned ballast state are correctly shown

1. connect to the Dali Device via the DALI-commissioning tool. 2. once connected, verify connected ballasts show up with short and long addresses, along with status. 3.check the box "hide unused addresses" and verify the only addresses are of that connected to the DALI. 4. click the "loop 2" button on the top left of the tool.

1. Number of ballasts connected should be noted on the top left of the tool, under the loop buttons. 2. each ballast connected should be listed with short/long address and status including the unused addresses. 3. once checked the unused addresses should go away and should only show as many ballasts as have been found on system. 4. all ballasts on loop 2 should be listed and unused addresses should be hidden.
Select ballast and make changes to ballast properties, check status details, copy ballast setting and save ballast setting. Perform refresh to retrieve ballast settings

1.continued from previous: select a ballast. 2. Click "identify ballast" button. (re-click once verified to turn off) 3. on the ballast, make some adjustments and changes to the ballast settings properties window. 4. Click save ballast settings. 5.Perform step 3 again. 6. Click "refresh ballast" 7. perform steps 3 &4 again, this time on multiple ballasts(selected one at a time) and click "save all ballast settings" then "refresh all ballasts".

1. ballast setting should appear in the tool. Verify no areas are greyed out. 2. the highlighted ballast should slowly blink. And the light fixture connected to the ballast should dim and raise as well. 3. Verify that current level, min/max level faders, fade rate and fade time etc are all responsive (cannot be checked without ballasts and fixtures attached) 4.after refreshing verify all settings have gone back to its original (previous) saved state. 5. after refreshing, all settings should have reverted to original (previous) saved state.

1.Connect to DIN-DALI device via the DALI-commissioning tool. 2.click on one of the loop buttons (1 or 2) 3.in the ballast settings box, click the "group editor" button. 4. Note what group 0 is and which it contains. 5. use the dropdown arrow in edit group and choose a group number. 6. select ballasts on the non-members side, and click the add to group button. 7. choose a few that were added to members, and click remove from group button. 8. click the remove all ballasts from all groups. 9. Add a few ballasts to the members group, and pick a random ballast. click the identify button. 10. click the box that says "identify ballasts when selected". randomly select ballasts. 11. click OK. reopen the group editor button and recheck what was done is saved.

Ballasts should be able to be added and removed from groups. Remove from all groups should remove all members from every group 0-15 identifying ballasts should cause the fixture connected to the ballast to fade up and down (as well as the selected ballast on screen to do the same).
clicking ok should save all changes.

1.Connect to the DIN-DALI device via the DALI-commissioning tool. 2. click the "scene editor" button. 3. Edit scene: scroll down and choose 0-15. (change accordingly when creating new scenes) click the Play scene: button, check tab play scene when selected. 4. in the Edit ballasts section, select the single ballast button. choose ballast, and adjust level... then click the box in the "include" section. 5. same section, select group and scroll down to a previously made group. adjust the levels and click ok. 6. same section, select all ballasts, adjust levels and include the ballasts you wish to use.

It should be possible to choose between 0-15 scenes.
Playing scene should change ballast level properties to adjust to the "saved" scene.
When choosing single/group/all, the include box should be the level that is added to the scene, all other paramters not checked with Include should stay as they were (so 100% should stay 100% etc)
1.After running through previous tests, at the bottom left of the tool, click "save report" button. 2.Name the file. And click save. 3.Navigate to the saved file, and open it.

File should save as .html
after opening the file, verify settings of ballasts (long/short address, power levels, group and scene etc) are as set in tool.
Disconnect DIN-DALI while connected to tool (Remove connection, reboot device)
* this will cause the device to stay in the session and will require reboot to the device to be able to re-connect toolbox.
Try connecting tool to a DIN-APC3.
Error message should state "not a valid device"

ss:Data.Font: Reconnecting tool after closing toolbox without closing session.

Cell.Data: 1. Open toolbox, open the DALI -commissioning tool. Connect to DALI device with ballasts on loops. 2. Once connected, close toolbox without closing the Dali commissioning tool. 3.Re-open toolbox, and open the DALI commissioning tool, and try to reconnect.

When connecting to a din-dali-2 device, if you do not disconnect from the session by closing the commissioning tool, you will have to power cycle the device to break it out of its hold. This is a known issue.
Trying to connect to device with tool, with multiple sessions.

1. Open toolbox, open the DALI -commissioning tool. Connect to DALI device with ballasts on loops. 2. Once connected, use a second computer, and try to connect the tool to the same device. Log result.
3. Re-do steps 1&2. this time instead of a second computer, open a second session of toolbox. Try to connect to the DALI device using the DALI commissioning tool. Log result.

You can not connect to a din dali 2 device in more than one session, or from 2 computers, this will cause lockouts and if in the middle of performing changes, possibly worse issues. (also known issue)
Verify overall performance of tool while executing above testcases

Notes:- 1. DDT tool will search the network for Crestron devices with different discovery protocols as, A. Ethernet B. USB and C. uPnP D. RS232 --> connect any device which support this connection D. Domotz 2. By default DDT discovers devices on the local area network. 3. There are limited amount of Crestron uPnP devices, to increase search speed uPnP search can be disabled 4. Discover devices via remote search with different connection type as, A. Auto B. SSH C. CTP D. SSL Note:- CTP and SSL might not discover devices because some of the control system do not support those connection type.
Able to discover devices from those connection types through which device got connected

1. Open toolbox>>Open the Device Discovery Tool.
Note:- DDT discovers devices which were connected on the same network only.

1. The tool will begin to auto-search for the connected crestron devices on the LAN 2. By default DDT will search devices locally, verify with Radio button selected on "Local Search" 3. verify the connected device were discovered on the discovery list
Note:- 1. Opening DDT tool always perfrom local search only when there are no filters (DDT>> Options>> un-checked under "when starting the tool options" 2. device will not discover if the device have autodiscovery off
need to file a bug for not having images for two device as: 1. CEN-ODT-C-POE 2. CCS-UC-CODEC-250

LAN: ==== 1. Open toolbox>>Open the Device Discovery Tool. 2. Select Remote Search Radio button >> select LAN option 3. Click the pencil and enter an IP of a Control system 4. Repeat same process of remote search through LAN with hostname of the same device as connected in step 3 above. 5. Repeat steps 3 and 4 for different connection types (ctp, ssl, ssh, usb, auto) 6. Similary, repeat steps 1 through 3 using 4, 3 series and 2 series control system 7. Repeat Remote search with LAN option from Addressbook and dropdown menu

1. Should display additional options to select between LAN, Control Subnet and Both 2. Should display the additional options to connect to the device such as ( address book icon, dropdown menu of address book, and pencil icon) 3. Should discover all connected device on the same network 4. Regardless of different approach to connect to the control system, should discover all associated devices on the network. 5. Should not discover devices under control subnet (if the selected device for remote discovery is the control system which has control subnet)
1. Discover devices under cotnrol subnet, sent out email to verify, to confirm whether it is a feature or a bug 2. able to repro the closed bug Toolbx-6479 which is marked as won't fix
1. Device Discovery: Allowed remote discovery from TSW-760

Repeat steps 3 and 4 for different connection types (ctp, ssl, ssh, usb, auto) 6. Similary, repeat steps 1 through 3 using 4, 3 series and 2 series control system 7. Repeat Remote search with Control Subnet option from Addressbook and dropdown menu
Note: for this test need to select control system which has a control subnet

Should discover all connected devices under control subnet of connected control system 4. Repeat same process of remote search through LAN with hostname of the same device as connected in step 3 above. 5. Repeat steps 3 and 4 for different connection types (ctp, ssl, ssh, usb, auto) 6. Similary, repeat steps 1 through 3 using 4, 3 series and 2 series control system 7. Repeat Remote search with Both option from Addressbook and dropdown menu

1. Should display additional options to select between LAN, Control Subnet and Both 2. Should display the additional options to connect to the device such as ( address book icon, dropdown menu of address book, and pencil icon) 3. Should discover all connected device on the same network including devices under control subnet 4. Regardless of different approach to connect to the control system, should discover all associated devices on the network and from the control subnet
1. Open DDT Tool >> click Rmote Search 2. Click Addressbook icon >> select saved Domotz agent Address book entry
1. should discover devices which are connected in same network as of Domotz agent 2. verify DDT winodow have information icon in bottom right corner.

1. Open toolbox>>Open DDT tool 2. From sort by drop down menu select different available options. A. Model name B. Hostname C. IP address D. Category E. FW version 3. Click arrow button next to dropdown menu of Sort by.
1. Should discover devices on the same network 2. should sort the devices as per user selections. 3. arrow button click should sort the devices in accending/decending.

1. Open toolbox>>Open DDT tool 2. Click on Quick Filter radio options A. Enter a filter string in the text field (Optional) B. Select either Model Name or Hostname radio button C. Select either Starts with or Contains radio button 3. Apply filter by clicking Ok button

1. Should discover devices based on currently selected method (Local/Remote) 2. Should filter out devices based on the specified criterias 3. Close/Reopen of the Toolbox session should clear out the quick filter

1. Open toolbox>>Open DDT tool 2. Click on Stored Filter radio option >>click CFG button 3. From Filter Configuration window>>click the Add New button and type a filter name in the center text field 4. In the Model Name and Hostname group boxes, enter an applicable search string in the text field. Separate search strings, in a text field, with a comma (syntax = space allowed before and after comma) 5. In the IP Address group box, enter the Starting and/or Ending IP Address to designate a range. A complete or partial IP Address string can be entered (Or wildcard * can be entered) 6. In category group box, select drop-down lists to filter the discovery results by three device categories 7. In the FW Version group box, enter the applicable complete or partial search string in the text field and select the applicable radio button. Only digits (0 to 9) and the '.' character are allowed. 8. Select a Match radio button with the "Must Match", "Optional" and "Exclude" options. 9. Click OK to exit out the filter configuration by saving the configuration 10. Reopen Filter Configuration window>>Select created filter

1. Should discover devices based on currently selected method (Local/Remote) 2. Should display the added filter with its set name in main DDT tool view under stored filter drop down menu 3. Should filter the devices as per stored filter configuration 4. Should save the filter configuration as per selections and should display the configuration that was set on reopen
2. DDT: Filter configuration dialogue accept invalid Starting and Ending IP address

1. Open toolbox>>Open DDT tool 2. Click Options button 3. In Discovery Options>>Select either Hostname or IP Address "Connect to Device by" radio button option 4. Click Ok 5. Double click a discovered device

1. Should discover devices based on currently selected method (Local/Remote) 2. Configuration window (Easy config view) should connect based on selected option (either with hostname or with IP address) succesfully

1. Open toolbox>>Open DDT tool 2. Click Options button 3. In Discovery Options>>Select either Enable uPnP or Disable uPnP "Include uPnP in Search" radio button option 4. Click Ok 5. Click Discover Devices Button

1. Should discover devices based on currently selected method (Local/Remote) 2. If attempting to disable uPnP, should display uPnP Device Warning dialog 3. Should discover the devices with selected uPnP search status (enable/disable) in the DDT main view
Note: - uPnP search status will display on right half side of DDT tool only for local search. However, discovery of device will execute based on uPnP section for both type of search
1. Open toolbox>>Open DDT tool 2. Click Options button 3. In Discovery Options>>Check Apply last filter and/or Use last search mode options 4. Click Ok 5. Close/Reopen tool

1. Should discover devices based on currently selected method (Local/Remote) 2. On reopen, the device descovery should follow checked rules - If Apply last filter, should have retained either the quick or stored filter selection - If use last search mode, should have retained the Local/Remote search selection
Add discovered devices to the addressbook

1. Should discover devices on the same network 2. should display add all filtered devices dialog and user should be able to select the avaiable options 3. the discovered devices should added on the current address book and New address book with the selected radio options of (hostname and Ip address)

1. Should discover devices based on currently selected method (Local/Remote) 2. Should rediscover devices based on current options. To determine if rediscover works, disconnect a discovered device and ensure after rediscover, it is no longer listed

1. Should discover devices based on currently selected method (Local/Remote) 2. If Autodiscovery is disable, DDT tool won't discover the devices and should display respective meaningful message 3. If Autodiscovery is enable, DDT tool should discover the devices on the same network as expected

the respective bug marked as INVALID but scenario is valid. Since another console, USB can't discover device when set as Autodiscovery OFF. Should be same thing for DOMOTZ connection as well, since it is a same device

Copy primary MAC Address D. Copy Serial number E. Add Hostname to current Addressbook F. Add IP Address to current Addressbook G. Add [Addresslist] to the Script manager script

If add hostname/IP address to current address book, verify it was added in the current addressbook with the specified address type 4. The Device Summary of the discovered devices will be written to a text file, which contains following information for each device: A. Hostname B. IP Address C. Model Name D. Firmware (version) E. TSID F. Serial Number 5. Verify the [addresslist] was added to the selected script manager script
Note: - 1. for USB discovered device, selecting Hostname to save address book, save address as USB Serial <serial number 2. verify copying MAC address with those device which doesn't have CCID (CEN-IO device)
1. Open Device Discovery Tool 2. Check near bottom of Tool for "Export…" button 3. Resize window

) 2. Resizing window should not distort any sections.

Open File Explorer and go to save location of ".csv" file 3. Double-click to open ".csv" file 4. Verify contents of ".csv" file

1. Filter the list of discovered devices in DDT by using the Quick Filter. 2. Repeat steps XiO_Trans_03 and XiO_Trans_04, and verify the new csv. 3. Repeat these steps for different filtering options.
1. The new csv file will contain only the filtered list of devices. 2. The csv file will include expected mac address and serial number of devices.
1. Click F1 to open Help File for DDT. 2. Verify contents of Help File are up to date and contain information regarding XiO Export. 3. Verify there are no typos or incorrect information.
1. Help File should contain the latest information for XiO Export. 2. There should be no typos or incorrect information.
1. Open toolbox>>Open the Device Discovery Tool. 2. Select Remote Search Radio button 3. Click the pencil and enter invalid or disconnected device address 4. Connect with auto option

Select the remote radio button 5. Using the address book dropdown box, choose the first device 6. Before the device finishes its search, use the dropdown box and pick the second device

Setup: Using a separate router, create an isolated network that is not part of the crestron network. Connect a few control system devices and a few non control system devices to the router. Make notes of the IP addresses. Piggy back that router onto a crestron network.
1. Ensure Pc is connected to the crestron network. 2. Open toolbox>>Open the Device Discovery Tool. 3. Click the remote search radio button. 4. Click the pencil and enter an IP of a device that is on the previously setup Isolated Network. 5. Perform all sorting options and filter options. 6. Repeat all steps, except this time connect pc to the router and connect to a device on the crestron network.

1. Once a remote search is completed, device discovery behaves the same as any other network 2. Devices can be filtered and addresses can be written to the address book 3. If VPN is employed, devices can be connected to by double clicking on the device

1. Open DDT 2. select Quick Filter radio option 3. Enter strings in Text field as: a) TSW, ^&*((((), CP3N b) *&^%$#@, CP3N, TSW c) CP3N, TSW, &^%$#@! 4. Repeat steps 3 by using space as its deliminator
1. should filter the discovered list by valid string, and ignore the invalid or not matching string

1. Should display connected DM Switcher Information at the very Top of DM Tool 2.Four buttons a. Names b. EDID c. Help d. Test Report 3. Two checkboxes a. Audio Follows Videos b. Gauge boarder color, value text and tooltip message changes based on its level a. 0-25 db = yellow. tooltip message = Please check that Mic Gain is set to desired value. b. 25.1-60 db = green. No tooltip message shown. 5. Help file notes details necessary for user about these controls

Gauge shown for all inputs (not including codec assignements) 4. Gauge color fill is always gray 5. Gauge value text appears directly below gauge with same color as gauge background 6. Please check that Input Compensation is set to desired value. b. (-4.9) - (5) dB = yellow. Tooltip message = Please check that Input Compensation is set to desired value. c. 5.1 - 10 dB = green. 7. Cell width for source inputs and codec assignments is combined width of "mix and pan level" and "mics master" cells for mic inputs 3. Gauge color fill is always gray unless muted (it then has red fill and border with text "Muted") 4. Gauge value text appears directly below gauge with same color as gauge background when not muted 5. Please check that Gain is set to desired value. b. (-39.9) - (-10) db = yellow. Tooltip message = Please check that Gain is set to desired value. c. (-9.9) - (10) dB = green. Pan control shown below level gauge with white border and red tick showing the current position of the pan feedback. 7 For any output, Mix Level has one active input source . Measure DM load time and configuration time

1. Close the open toolbox and make sure close the VPTComserver as well (if opened) 2. Open DMPS tool and connect with DMPS3-300-C device; immideately start the clock time 3. Stop the clock when DMPS tool is ready after device initialize 4. Repeat same process 1 - 3 for 5 consecutive time.
Note:- at different time the performance of the tool might vary due to network traffic. So to have a base, run the performance on latest released TB version as well and average out after 5 consecutive runs.
1. Record the time for each run 2. Calculate the average

1. Performance test was based on opening DMPS tool connecting with DMPS3-300-C device (make sure every time close TB and vptcomserver) -- rough time to initilize in TB v3.01.438 was 36 secs. -- rough time for TB v3.01.521 was 55.64 secs. -- rough time for TB v3.01.638 was 52.16 secs. -- average time for TB v3.01.761 was 43.1 secs -- average time for TB v3.01.664 was 48.2 secs. -- average time for TB v3.01.814 was 48.6 secs -- average time for TB v3.03.112 was 46.2 secs -- average time for TB v3.05.021 was 1:19 mins (seems like previous TB v3.03.424 have average time as 1:18 mins) -- average time for TB v3.05.116 was 1:18 mins -- average time for Tb v3.09.114 was 1:20 mins

VESA Block, from this section user should be able to customize the new VESA setting with its own Timing Descriptors, Established and Standard Timing. C. CEA Block, from this section user should be able to customize the new CEA Setting with its own Video Timings and Audio Formats. D. EDID File Functions, from which user can select already available standard templates and modify it, save and open the customized EDID profile and create a new EDID Profile.

1. Open EDID tool from Toolbox 2. Verify the VESA Block display

1. should display three sections of read only text Fields and one button 2. Those read only text Fields were for displaying information of Selected or Created template for its following Information A. Preferred Detailed Timing Descriptor--> by default should be 1024x768p@60Hz B. Second Detailed Timing Descriptor--> by default should be 800x600p@60Hz C. Established Timing-->by default should be 640x480p@60Hz D. Standard Timing--> by default should be empty 3. Modify Button

The EDID Configuration Tool allows to modify the portion of an EDID that Crestron supports. Crestron DM systems may support more features than the EDID tool an edit. The entire EDID--the modified and unmodified portion--is saved when the EDID is saved. Similarly, the entire EDID is sent when the Tool sends the EDID to the device.

1. Doesn't retains the same position, enhancement bug 2. There is one issue, let's say user select 4K60 444 ... templete from the available list, upon clicking New button will display the message to save. 3. Verify connected USB learner device with Testing PC
Refer Figure(1) for UI. 1. Open Device learner tool and verify the default UI

ss:Data.Font: 1. Device learner should have two tabs- Device description and Remote button A. . Device Description-There are two section - IR information and Crestron SDK driver information. --> IR File Information (should be identical with previous TB build) --> Crestron SDK driver information, this section should have following information as, - Driver version -Warmup Time (secs) -Cooldown Time (secs) - Enable Media Services -Enable Multiple Power off commands -Supported series - Textbox and Add button to enter in list -Supported models- Textbox and Add button to enter in list
-Connectors: - IO Type, - Audio Connected, - Standard command , - Friendly Name, - Add button (+) - Subtract button (-)

Cell.Data: Verify user can create IR files

1.File>> New >>Device detail tab >> Add details of device to be controlled 2. Ensure "Create Crestron SDK Driver" checkbox option under "Device Type" is unchecked (so IR file type is created) 3. Go to Remote Buttons Tab>> Click "+" button to add a button 4. Learning IR code by pressing "Learn" button. Or, by entering IR Pronto code (by right clicking on desired button and selecting "Enter Pronto .CFF Data Format option) 5. Click "Test" button to verify entered/learn IR code works.

1. Should be able to set the device information for a respective Device Type in "IR File Information" group box 2. Should be able to create a button with IR data (whether learned or entered) 3. Learned LED should turn green if successful, and if not then it should turn red 3. Should able to verify the learned/entered IR code with "Test" button press 4. Verify the "Good" checkbox option is checked if "Test" button confirms IR code

Verify Power Cool down time/Warmup time

Power Cool down time: 1.Issuer Power OFF command. 2.Issue any command before set power cool down time. 3. Issue command after set power cool down time.
Power Warmup time: 1. Issuer Power ON command and issue command 2.Issue any command before set power warmup time. 3. Issue command after set power warmup time.

1. Power OFF command should shut down. 2. Sending command before Cooldown is not send to device. 3. Command send after Cooldown time send to device 4. Power ON command turns TV ON. 5. Sending command before warmup time is not send to device. 6. Command send after after warm time send to device

When user drag and drop the program into device, TB display different kind of option depend on which type of files or folder are going to the device.
a) If the files is .lpz then user will prompt with "Transfer File" and "Load Program" option
b) if the files is zip file then user will prompt with "Transfer File" and "Update Firmware" option.
c) if the files is other than zip and .lpz then user will not prompt with any message and got transfer automatically.

Obtain list of supported devices and run above tests for all supported devices 6. Check help file for details about conditions for Direct PUF controls to appear

1. Tool controls that provide Direct PUF functionality only appear when these conditions are met: a. Selected PUF file meets minimum version requirement b. Selected PUF file is for supported device c. Connected device is a supported device d. Connected device meets minimum version requirement 2. Text in tool has no spelling or gramar issues 3. Help file sufficiently describes conditions for Direct PUF controls to appear

Cell.Data: Confirm correct behavior with Asynchronous update mode

Run Direct PUF update and close PUF tool after file transferred to device, but before puf command sent 3. Reopen tool in cases listed below. For each case, connect to device and select PUF file previously sent: a. right after closing it b. 1 minute after closing it c. 5 minutes after closing it d. 10 minutes after closing it e. 30 minutes after closing it f. 40 minutes after closing it. g. 60 minutes after closing it. 6. Check Help file for information on Asynchronous mode

1. User properly notified about existance of asynchronous mode and how it works 2. User prevented from closing PUF tool by significant warning anytime before file is transferred to device and puf command sent 3. User is notified that update will continue after closing tool and is not prevented from closing tool after file transferred and puf command sent 4. Upon reopening PUF tool, selecting PUF file and connecting to device all details displayed are accurate and useful including: a. Device and puf versions b. Results of last puf update c. View of Connected Devices section: 1. Open InfinetEx diagnostic tool and connect with Gateway devices as mentioned in "Overviews, Req's & Revisions" 2. verify all columns in "connected devices" listbox

1. Should display InfinetEx Diagnostic tool main view as shown in figure 1 below. 2. Connected Device section should have following columns information as: a) Model: Display type of connected device model name b) Network: Display types of connected device c) ID: Display Infinet ID of respective connected devices d) S/N: Display serial number of repective conneted devices e) Firmware: Display firmware version of respective connected devices f) # of Hops: Display the number of devices that are between the current device and the gateway, including the gateway h) Link Quality: Display the quality of the link between the device and the hop with the worst link quality. The overlay color indicates whether the connection is Excellent (green), Good (green), Satisfactory (yellow) or Poor (red). i) Neighbor Count: Display the total number of neighboring devices, including the gateway
Note:- # of Hops and Neighbor Count do not exist for Sub-G networks (or Battery Shade device). They will indicate "N/A" for Sub-G networks

Display information of Selected device in following colums: a) Hop: Display information of the number of hops from the device to the other device or gateway b) Model: Display information of the Crestron model name c) ID: The RF ID. (The gateway does not report an RF ID.) d) S/N: The serial number of the device. e) Link Quality: The quality of the link to the next closest hop. The overlay color indicates whether the connection is Excellent (green), Good (green), Satisfactory (yellow) or Poor (red).

1. Open InfinetEx diagnostic tool and connect with Gateway devices as mentioned in "Overviews, Req's & Revisions" 2. From Connected Devices listbox section >> select any connected device

1. Should display InfinetEx Diagnostic tool main view as shown in figure 1 below. 2. Verify information in Neighbor Table section. Display information of Selected device in following colums: a) Model: Display information of the Crestron model name of the neighbor b) ID: The RFID of the neighbor. c) S/N: The serial number of the neighbor. d) Firmware: The firmware version of the neighbor. e) # of Hops: Display the number of devices that are between the current device and the gateway, including the gateway f) Link Quality: Display the quality of the link between the device and the hop with the worst link quality. The overlay color indicates whether the connection is Excellent (green), Good (green), Satisfactory (yellow) or Poor (red). g) Neighbor Count: Display the total number of neighboring devices, including the gateway
Note:- # of Hops and Neighbor Count do not exist for Sub-G networks (or Battery Shade device). They will indicate "N/A" for Sub-G networks

1. Open Tools and select Power Management Tool from Toolbox 2. connect UPS device
1. should display the Power management Tool containing three tabs A. Status B. Setup C. Logs
1. Open Power Management Tool and connect with its comptible device 2. Select Status Tab

1. Should display five sections, among them one is Power Condition which have following information A. Input Voltage: The input utility voltage level. Reported values will range from 0V to 150V. B. Output Voltage: The voltage level being output to connected devices. Reported values will range from 0V to 150V. C. Operating Frequency: The operating frequency in Hertz. When on line power, the operating frequency is the frequency of the line voltage, typically 60Hz. When on battery power it is the AC frequency generated by the CEN-UPS1250, also typically 60Hz. Reported values will range from 0Hz to 63Hz. D. Load: The current load of the connected equipment, expressed as a percentage (0% to 100%) of the total allowable load connected to the unit. (The rated load of the CEN-UPS1250 is 1250 Watts/1440 VA.) E. LED on Overloaded: Active (red) feedback on the LED icon indicates an overloaded output condition. This signifies that the attached devices are drawing more current than the CEN-UPS1250 can supply. When the unit is overloaded, unplug the connected devices one at a time until the LED icon dims. F. LED on Boosting: Active (green) feedback on the LED icon indicates that the CEN-UPS1250 is in Smart Boost mode to compensate for a low incoming AC line voltage. This occurs when the input voltage from the utility is below the under-voltage level specified in the Setup tab, which will cause the unit to go on battery power temporarily. The under-voltage level can range from 92V to 100V.
G. LED on Trimming: Active (green) feedback on the LED icon indicates that the CEN-UPS1250 is in Smart Trim mode to compensate for a high incoming AC line voltage. This occurs when the input voltage from the utility is above the over-voltage level specified in the Setup tab, which will cause the unit to go on battery power temporarily. The over-voltage level can range from 134V to 142V.
1. Open Power Management Tool and connect with its comptible device 2. Select Status Tab

1. Battery section should display following information
A. Remaining: The remaining fuel capacity of the internal battery pack expressed as a percentage (0% to 100%), based on the total load connected to the unit.
B. Estimated Runtime: The estimated remaining runtime on battery power in minutes. Reported values will range from 0 to 200.
C. Using Battery: Active (red) feedback on the LED icon indicates that the CEN-UPS1250 is operating on power from the internal battery pack and is providing clean power to the connected equipment. The unit will go "On Battery" when: 1) the input utility voltage either drops below or goes above the voltage transfer levels specified in the Setup tab; or 2) when an outage or momentary drop or surge in input utility voltage occurs; or 3) when the input voltage distortion exceeds the noise sensitivity level specified in the Setup tab.
D. Battery Low: Active (red) feedback on the LED icon indicates a low battery condition. This occurs when the battery pack's estimated runtime remaining (reported by the "Estimated Runtime" field) has dropped to or below the programmed setting (specified in SIMPL Windows). The purpose of this warning is to allow time to shut off power to the equipment before the battery pack is fully discharged.
1. Open Power Management Tool and connect with its comptible device 2. Select Status Tab

1. Environmental Section should display following informtion
A. Internal Temp: The internal temperature of the CEN-UPS1250 in degrees Fahrenheit. Reported values will range from 0°F to 212°F.
B. Ambient Temp: The external temperature in degrees Fahrenheit, as detected by the environmental probe. Reported values will range from 0°F to 212°F.
C. Ambient Humidity: The external relative humidity, as detected by the environmental probe. Reported values will range from 0% to 100% RH. This CEN-UPS1250 operates in the humidity range of 10% to 90% RH (non-condensing).

1. Open Power Management Tool and connect with its comptible device 2. Select Setup Tab 3. Select Outlet Bank 1 and change the setting on each available text fields 4. Click Apply 5. Repeat steps 1 - 4 for other Outlet Banks as well

1. should have control to entered values based on following information Shutdown Click the check box next to a shutdown option to enable shutdown configuration, as follows: A. Wait __ Seconds: Type the number of seconds to wait after the unit goes on battery power before turning off the outlet bank. This allows the system to conserve battery power. Delay values range from 1s through 65535s. The default value of 0 signifies "no action". That is, when this field is set to 0 (or the check box is not selected) nothing will happen when the unit goes on battery.
B. Wait __ % Battery Remaining: Type the low-battery threshold that must be exceeded before turning off the outlet bank. This signifies that when input power fails and the CEN-UPS1250 battery capacity drops below the specified percentage, the outlet bank will turn off. Percentages range from 1% to 100%. The default value of 0 signifies "no action". That is, when this field is set to 0 (or the check box is not selected) the battery capacity will not be considered when deciding to shut down or not.
C. Wait __ % of Maximum: Type the load threshold that must be exceeded before turning off the outlet bank. This signifies that when the output voltage drawn from the CEN-UPS1250 exceeds the specified percentage of output load, the outlet bank will turn off. Percentages range from 1% to 100%. The default value of 0 signifies "no action". That is, when this field is set to 0 (or the check box is not selected) the percentage of output load will not be considered when deciding to shut down or not.

1. need to put a enhancement bug for allowing user to enter characters in wait text fields. These field suppose to accept integer value only 2. check boxes selection doesn't retains back after surfing to different Outlet bank and came a back

Startup Click the check box next to a startup option to enable startup configuration, as follows:
A. Wait __ Seconds: Type the number of seconds to wait after general power-up to power the outlet bank, or when switching from battery to line power (if the outlet bank is off). This allows the connected equipment to be powered up in the proper sequence, with the right amount of delay between stages. The delay eliminates transients that can affect connected components, or that may cause a circuit breaker to trip. Delay values range from 1s through 65535s. The default value of 0 signifies "no action". That is, when this field is set to 0 (or the check box is not selected) the outlet bank will not turn on automatically after general power-up.
B. Clicking the outlet bank's On/Off button on the Status tab will immediately turn on the outlet bank, bypassing any programmed delay.
C. Wait __ % Battery Remaining: Type the minimum battery percentage that must be reached before restoring the power to the outlet bank. This takes effect after a transition from battery power to line power, to ensure that the battery has charged up to a satisfactory level. Percentages range from 1% to 100%. The default value of 0 signifies "no action". That is, when this field is set to 0 (or the check box is not selected) the battery capacity will not be considered when deciding to restore power or not.

Downloading Security Policy from cloud when local copy have lower version of Security Policy by modifying security policy xml file

1. Lower down the SecurityPolicy version number from xml file which is available on following C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Local\Crestron\Toolbox\SecurityPolicy Note:- Also, modify the available content by adding or deleting on SecurityPolicy.xml 2. Save the modified SecurityPolicy xml file and exit 3. Setup a registry by running following command on window's prompt as: "reg add "HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Crestron Electronics Inc.\Toolbox\SecurityChecker\CloudUpdateTest" /v "TestBlobURL" /d "https://toolboxtesting.blob.core.windows.net/securitytooltesting" /f" 4. Open Security Audit Tool from Toolbox 5. Run "TC_COSA_00" test case once again
Note: - make sure delete the registry after finishing the test from "HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Crestron Electronics Inc.\Toolbox\SecurityChecker\CloudUpdateTest"

1. Should update the local security policy automatically (this can be verify by clicking view button from Main Security Audit tool and check the last update time and its policy version, more information refer to figure 1). 2. Make sure no extra step have to take to update the Security Policy from the cloud. 3. Verify the security policy updated (version level and modified content) by checking "Securitypolicy.xml"from following location (C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Local\Crestron\Toolbox\SecurityPolicy). Note:- security policy will updated as per available information on cloud. 4. Verify the security policy from view window (by clicking view button from security audit tool) 5. should display the expected result as mentioned in TC_COSA_00 test case
Note:- The Moment of opening security audit tool, local security policy get updated (if lower than cloud security policy) with in no time. Due to which can't verify that process run background.

Open Security Audit Tool from Toolbox 5. Run "TC_COSA_00" test case once again
Note: - make sure delete the registry after finishing the test from "HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Crestron Electronics Inc.\Toolbox\SecurityChecker\CloudUpdateTest"

Signal Mode 1. Open Simpl Debugger tool and connect with Control System 2. Go to Debugging Settings option one next to help on Crestron Toolbox 3. select "Signal Mode" option 4. Select "Send All Signals" 5. Follow steps from 1 - 4 and select "Send Only Specified Signals"

1. Signal mode determines how signals are filtered for debugging 2. Send All Signals (default): This mode automatically reports all signal transitions as they occur. From this mode user then exclude signals from debugging via the Stop Debugging command.
Send only Specified Signals: This mode reports only the signal transitions of signals that are explicitly marked for debugging via the Start Debugging command.
